document_title: Polycystic ovary syndrome: Causes, signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) is a common hormonal disorder in women of reproductive age. The disease has many effects on the ovaries, causing menstrual cycle disorders, increasing male hormone levels, leading to the formation of many small cysts inside the ovaries.
Statistics show that about 2.2 - 26.7% of women of reproductive age (15 - 44 years old) have polycystic ovary syndrome. And many of them do not know they have the disease, so they do not treat it early, leading to many complications. (first)
